thread.title: Walkthru: What's next after bye weekend?
thread.title_full: Walkthru: What's next after bye weekend?

title: Walkthru: What's next after bye weekend?
text:
Walkthru: Bengals' Good Bye Weekend Paul Dehner Jr. , pdehnerjr@enquirer.com 9:31 a.m. EDT October 26, 2015 Looking at a prosperous off day for the Bengals, plus, far off Hue Jackson/Jay Gruden scenarios, explaining health, Dunlap at ESPN, return of JFF, bye week stats and PJ Monday. (From left:) Wide receivers A.J. Green, Mohamed Sanu, Marvin Jones and Brandon Tate sit on the bench during the Oct. 18 win over the Bills.. (Photo: The Enquirer/Kareem Elgazzar) 14 CONNECT 6 TWEET LINKEDIN 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Hope you all had a great bye weekend. I know those feel empty for many of you with the Bengals not playing, for those of us caught up in the constant grind ever since training camp started in July, few weekends are sweeter. The imprint on my couch digs a little deeper today. 
As for the Bengals, sitting around and watching turned out to be profitable with Kansas City pulling the upset at home against Pittsburgh. The Chiefs had lost five in a row, but were able to take down the Steelers with Landry Jones at quarterback. All signs point to Ben Roethlisberger returning next week against the Bengals, but partially due to his injury, the Steelers must dig out of a 2.5-game hole if they want to catch the Bengals. 
If you consider the fact they would face a 3.5-game deficit and still have to come to Cincinnati if they can't pull off the victory Sunday, the importance of the tilt Sunday at Heinz Field raises dramatically for a game this time of year. 
I remember surveying the table at Beyond The Stripes of what they think the Steelers' record would be during the month he was expected to miss. Nearly all said 2-2. Turned out to be true, though, not the wins/losses we expected. Without your leader you can only hold the pieces together for so long. Still, Sunday will be the first game all year they play with Roethlisberger, Antonio Brown, Martavis Bryant, Le'Veon Bell all on the field together. Eventually they add Maurkice Pouncey to the mix. They are incredibly dangerous. 
As The Carpenters would say ... 
ON TAP TODAY 
The team returns from bye week for their first practice. We will learn more about the status of Vontaze Burfict this week. He could be a participant in today's practice. Keep an eye on the Twitter accounts of Jim-O ( @JimOwczarski ) and I ( @pauldehnerjr ) for updates on what we see. 
TWITTER QUESTION OF THE DAY @pauldehnerjr if Hue is hired as a HC, would you think @Bengals pursue Gruden if @Redskins let him go? — Michael Oshita (@MichaelOshita) October 25, 2015 
Thanks for the question, Michael. That small object barely viewable over the horizon would be the cart in front of your horse. 
I think Hue Jackson has absolutely coached his way into a head coaching job. He was close with Buffalo last year and that was before he found a way to transform Andy Dalton in Year 5. If Dalton and the Bengals offense continues down this path he will be near the top of every team's list. This league is defined by developing quarterbacks. That looks mighty pretty on top of his resume. So, say he does land a head job and all stays the same here. You also need Gruden to get fired in Washington. Which, with Daniel Snyder is always a reality, but he does have them at 3-4 with Kirk Cousins at QB, RG3 scandal aside. 
I'm sure there would be interest should those two scenarios play out. The coaching staff is comfortable with him, Gruden knows the players here well. This franchise LOVES known quantities. Gruden would be that. To speculate anywhere beyond wouldn't be fair to any party involved. Far too many variables. 
IN CASE YOU MISSED IT 
Fantastic deep dive from Jim-O into why the Bengals remarkable health this season could span well beyond luck , rather at a carefully constructed change to the program taking care of players' bodies. This could end up the most important story of the season should this health continue. 
BENGALS BYE WEEK EXPLOITS 
Carlos Dunlap, NFL sack leader entering the weekend, dropped into ESPN on Sunday to join their coverage. — Carlos Dunlap (@Carlos_Dunlap) October 25, 2015 
AROUND THE DIVISION 
Steelers (4-3): Pittsburgh's defense needed to carry them through this rough patch and they couldn't. Still, optimism reigns with Ben's return. 
Browns (2-5): Josh McCown goes out in loss to St. Louis and JFF, set to be questioned by the NFL, might be the starter in Cleveland. They play the Bengals in 10 days. 
Ravens (1-5): Baltimore's depleted secondary will be tested against Arizona. They think a win on MNF could flip their season. 
BY THE NUMBERS 
Will be many questions, I assume, about how the Bengals play coming off a bye week. Here's the rundown. In the Marvin Lewis Era they rank 29th in the NFL in record coming off a bye (4-7-1, 36%). Placing a little whip cream on that dung, they rank near the middle of the pack in those games against the spread number. Basically, they've played some quality opponents after a bye and still kept many of them close. 
Since 2009, they are in the middle of the pack, 3-3 after a bye. They are 2-2 in the Dalton-Green Era. 
TEAM TWEET OF THE WEEKEND 
Kirk Cousins. All jacked up. How do you feel about Victory Monday? #YouLikeThat pic.twitter.com/EyXui6qxTo — Washington Redskins (@Redskins) October 26, 2015 
RANDOMNESS 
Pretty sure this ridiculous spider found in the rainforest is related to a bug I killed in my basement earlier this year. 
History of the Reebok Pump. Hell yes I had the pump. Though stories of overpumping shoe explosion kind of scared me. 
Stanford offensive lineman goes street fight destruction block mode . Honestly looks like a scene out of an embellished football movie. 
Much credit to ESPN o n this spoof of Angels in the Outfield as a 30 for 30 . "Nobody ever took time to ask why this manager was spending so much time with two little boys." 
AND FINALLY 
In honor of Ben's likely return to the Steelers, I'm sure this would fit around Pittsburgh this weekend. 14 CONNECT 6 TWEET LINKEDIN 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://cin.ci/1S5ZLNv TOP VIDEOS
